ygData.subject: Re: bazaar
ygData.msgSnippet: Got on in the bazaar at a good time, with few enough people that the lag was not terminal. Buy a trader satchel, load it up. Find a spot on one of the trading
ygData.messageBody:
Got on in the bazaar at a good time, with few enough people that the
lag was not terminal.

Buy a trader satchel, load it up. Find a spot on one of the trading
platforms. You cannot trade if you are not on a platform. Type /trade
and set your prices. Hit List Items so others can scan the list. Now
either sit there and chat or afk and do something else.

I sold for an hour, but no buyers. Then I scanned the shopping list
and found a hq brute hide for 5pp. Seemed a good deal, so I bought
it, banked, and logged.

This is a fabulous setup once you get it set up. Find a spot on the
platform and your toon can sell all day while you work or sleep. Just
the thing when you actually want to eat in real life. A real meal, I
mean, not just gamer food.

Barto Proudfoot

--- In EverQuest@y..., "Su" <suceress@k...> wrote:
> Heh.
> How do you set up to sell in the bazaar anyways?
> luv,
> -Su
>
> > Went there this morning to set up some sales. Lag was terrible. It
> > was hard to even get my cursor on target. I suppose it will be ok
> > once I get set up to sell, but the set up is terrible. Move
cursor.
> > Not on object. Move a bit more. Not on object. Move back. Click.
> > Don't have object. Click again. Hmph. Had object but didn't know
it,
> > and just put it back. Click...
> >
> > Took so long that I didn't finish setting up before I had to log.
I
> > wouldn't have logged if I could have left my toon to do business
> > while I was gone, but no such luck.
> >
> > I just gotta get another machine, faster connection, and retire
from
> > my job so that I can play all the time.
> >
> > Barto Proudfoot
